events.name: The banana is invented.
events.detail: Bananas are a widely consumed fruit grown mainly in tropical latitudes. In recent years the banana has come under fire from workers who claim that banana plantations represent the risks of capitalist greed.

events.name: Canada has its 100th anniversary.
events.detail: ... sort of. The Constitution Act, or British North America Act, defined most of the operation of the government. Everyone likes Canada, unless it's Hate Canada month.

events.name: Niels Bohr makes everyone jealous.
events.detail: There are little round things everywhere and they stick together sometimes to make bigger things.

events.name: An Archduke dies.
events.detail: Because of one prince and a bunch of almost-incompetent revolutionaries, the world is set on fire.

events.name: Poland does not have fun.
events.detail: This could be any day in the 20th century, really, but this day in particular was bad.

events.name: A sunbeam tiger pokes a sleeping giant.
events.detail: Not really sleeping, though. That's just what they wanted everyone to think. The day lives on in infamy.

events.name: A fungus becomes a lifesaver.
events.detail: Personally, I'm allergic to penicillin. Good for everyone else, though.

events.name: The Atari 2600 is released in North America.
events.detail: A game console that some say defined a generation. A different generation from the other console in this database. I wasn't there, I don't know.

events.name: Nintendo makes the Famicom happen in Japan.
events.detail: A game console that some say defined a generation. A different generation from the other console in this database. I wasn't there, I don't know.

events.name: The first nuclear power plant comes online.
events.detail: Nuclear power lights up homes in Arco, Idaho. It's efficient! It's safe! It makes bucketloads of power! Is that an extra arm you're growing?
